caption: (Translated by Google) Super first time that I go and I liked it, I will return ..  (Original) Súper primera ves que voy y me gusto,  volveré..

Just wanted to share our beautiful experience from i Ricchi Italian Restaurant in DC. Every food made from scratch. Their homemade gelato and cheese cake was the best!!!!  Exceptional waiters and very cozy atmosphere.  My iPhone photos do not justice deliciousness of each food!
Service was very good. Food was good but not great ( chicken wad a bit overdone)

Absolutely delicious food - and that comes from two foodies who lived in Naples, Italy for half a dozen years! "Molto buono" as they say!  We had dined here the other night, as my wife had purchased a groupon for our up-coming anniversary, but then we learned that DC was making drastic changes to dining in, due to covid, so we rushed in.  The inside was warm and inviting - tables were set apart and wait staff stayed well away, while wearing masks and gloves the entire time. The focaccia was served in individually wrapped portions, and was tasty, full of texture and a perfect accompaniment to our meal!  We both had the scallops and mushroom appetizer, which I thought was delightful, especially as I had never before seen such a pairing. Coupled with just a few pieces of gnocchi to give it some substance, I thought it was perfect.  I had the rigatoni for my main dish and it was perfect - if I closed my eye, I could have been in Tuscany! My wife had the veal milanese (a more northern italian dish - akin to german weiner schnitzel) and really enjoyed it, complaining that they had given her too much food!  For dessert, I had the house specialty, cheesecake, which was crusted with nuts and very tasty, yet unlike any other cheesecake I've ever had. My wife had the semifreddo and raved about the wonderfully delicate layers of strawberry goodness the entire ride home.  I almost forgot to mention, our waiter has worked at THIS SAME restaurant for 14 years. Suffice it to say, he knew the menu and his recommendations were spot-on! ALSO, this was the best (maybe the only?) place that we have been and not treated like second class citizens for using a groupon!!  If you like great Italian food - this is your place! We'll certainly be back!!
Great food, fantastic staff. I highly recommend I Ricchi, great place for a date also ;-)
Lovely terrace, Tuscan food and service.
Great service. Great food. Ambience was wonderful.
Great authentic Italian food

Phenomenal - every time! The flavors, the pasta, the creativity in the meals - I would eat here every day if I could afford the calories. We joined the Food Club and had a total of 6 meals to include the wine pairing. It's so good and highly recommended. The food is packaged nicely and you'll receive a pamphlet on the background of the food, to include a little story about the chef and her experiences in that particular region of Italy. It's a great way to spend a covid-Friday night.

The food was overall great..... and to specifically highlight, the lamb and 12-hour Rigatoni were spectacular. For dessert the gelato was as rich as it was creamy-wonderful. The Tiramisu however, was a little more dry then I would like. Would've loved to have seen more coffee liqueur/rum/brandy involved. Service was on par with the quality of the food and ambiance of the restaurant. Our server was quite the professional and went the distance and a little extra to ensure our experience was great Kudos  I Ricchi !
Amazing service and food. Free valet parking. Definitely going often.
The bread, scallops and asparagus were delicious!

food was NOT that special at all and we were rushed out by the waiter like we weren't wanted there anymore-- they asked us for our coat check tags before we even finished paying. Waiter was SO rude to us. food was way over priced for the quality.... except the bread though that was tasty. would not recommend this place to anyone .

General manager shows no integrity. Basically called me a liar after I had called ahead to check (and double check) on using a gift certificate and would not honor what I was told on the phone. I also mentioned it to the waiter when we sat down and was never told of any issue - didn’t know until we got the bill.
Best Italian in the city, bar none.

Me and my husband used this groupon, and you definitely recieved different services than non groupon users, notably so. No, it was not a race issue, just another sort of issue. The waitress definitely catered to a certain type of "clientele", and I guess we were not it.
great authentic Florentine Italian. excellent light choices, but don't expect saucy pastas and thick marinara

I’ve had lunch here recently and we were here for valentines as well. While valentines felt a bit rushed overall I think the food is very good. The rigatoni is just a classic and the whole experience is very good. A nice little place for a meal.

Maybe it was a valentine thing or maybe it's an every night thing, I can't tell as this was my first time to this restaurant. I got there on time for an 8:15 reservation. There was a line of people out the door waiting to give their name to the hostess. It was cold so we crammed in line, essentially creating a fire hazard situation as people trying to exit had no room to pass. The line was not moving. About 5 minutes after we got there, a hostess with a clipboard came by to take our name. She told us we should go to the bar as "this is going to take a while." It would have been nice to be offered a complimentary drink at this point seeing that some overbooking mistake had been made. No such offer was forthcoming.  I got a basic gin and tonic at the bar. As my girlfriend and I were waiting, we noticed about 4 empty tables which remained empty over the next 30 minutes while we waited. Another strange observation was that not a single person seated had a plate of food in front of them. Just as I was about to call it quits and find another spot for dinner, the hostess came by to get us to our table. We went but not before I paid $17 for my drink. It's a fairly decent restaurant in DC so I expect to pay a lot for a cocktail, but when I got to my table and looked at the menu I noticed that all of their cocktails are $14. Not sure why I paid more for a gin and tonic...  Earlier in the night we saw someone carrying several coats, but we were never offered any coat service. Our table was crammed and my chair seemed to be jutting out too far into the walkway and in the way of the wait staff. Our waiter was nice but service was slow. We ordered the marinated colossal shrimp as one of our entrees. Let's just say that they should mention that this dish is composed of only 3 shrimp and 4 slices of grilled pepper and onion. For $36, this was a disappointingly paltry amount of food. The chicken we ordered by contrast was a solid (but dry) half chicken that we couldn't put a dent in. The highlights of dinner were the bread basket, the caprese salad, wild mushroom appetizer and home made spaghetti.  The night was unfortunately only memorable for its odd highlights.
Great service. Excellent food 👍

If your in the mood for "real" Italian food look no further. I have dined here a couple times, with a very large group and then with another couple. Every time I dine here it is great. When I seen this place had 3 stars I was floored; no way! Food is the best  I've ever had, the service is professional. I send friends here all the time and they always say great things about it. Try it for yoUrself at least once, I'm sure you'll decide  to  return.
Maybe I chose the wind meal off of the menu, but I want impressed by either portion size or the taste of the food. Other people said their meals were good.. The bread was great, as was the service
Love this place!
We have been here a couple of times, and once again they did not disappoint!  My husband and I both had the filetto alla zingara and it was excellent.

I’ve been here 3 or 4 times before and everything including the food and service was great. I just went again and I have never felt so rushed before. Our waiter insisted we order within the first 30 seconds of looking at the menu and practically cleared our plates while finishing our food. There was no personal introduction or explanation of the menu as there has been in the past, or as you would expect at a nicer restaurant. He also never came by to do the basic inquiry into how our food came out. The portions were a lot smaller than in the past and the side of potatoes that came with my swordfish tasted and looked like they were “instant” mashed potatoes from a packet. Not sure if I will be coming back or recommending this place to friends or family anymore

We visited iRicci while staying in Washington D.C. at the Marriott Mayflower! This restaurant cane highly recommended. Once we visited this restaurant we were thrilled. Our waiter was Said. We had an unbelievably busy day in D.C. and welcomed suggestions. Said offered suggestions to us. We had amazing red wine, lamb, a fabulous scallop appetizer, and amazing tiramisu. It was all spot on.  We could not have wanted more. We left so happy with our experience here. We are hoping to return to D.C. soon. We will return here as well. Said will be the gentleman we will we request. Thanks iRicci.   Nicholas and Vadette
Love this place enduringly. Always get a ragú.
Service was...ok ..salmon was just warm not even hot and portion was small , not to mention very dry..I cant go into detail because it would take me too long to explain..
Terrific food, lovely holiday warmth

I would describe the chicken entree and meatball appetizer as okay. Maybe my sin was ordering a chicken entree at an Italian restaurant but it was pretty dry. However the chocolate mousse dessert was excellent. Went in for a work lunch with several people with no RSVP and service was prompt and courteous. Price wise, I probably wouldn't come back if I was using my own money because I can just get something more enjoyable for cheaper.
Close to the airport, very secure and great rooms at affordable rates.

It was Tuesday, I'm a woman and a member of I Ricchi's Woman's Club, so I got to eat a fabulous lunch for half price.  The pasta del giorno was angel hair pasta made in house with shrimp, scallops and peas.  The torta del formaggio was a marscapone cheese cake with a walnut crust that was so delicious I took my time and savored every bite.  Top quality food is the reason I Ricchi has been in business for over thirty years.  Excellent service by server Alex contributed to making this lunch so special.
Classic Italian, great people
Under rated restaurant! Try their veal Milanese and their spaghetti! Also service was top notch.
Delicious food, warm atmosphere, helpful staff

This place has been around for a long time and it shows.  They have the same old decor they have had for decades and it is time for an update. Also it seemed the menu was limited and the food was nothing to write home about. In addition, the portions were very small, especially given the big price tags.  I have patronized this restaurant for many years but I will not be going back unless there are some big changes made.
Service was awesome. Food, not so much. This is just MY experience.....
Beat Veal I think I ever had, and very friendly staff.it was a great meal to remember!
Holy Moly that was great pasta! Every bite was incredible.
My favorite Italian restaurant in all of DC. Top notch food and service, as well as a cozy ambience. Semifreddo is easily one of my favorite desserts as well.
Outstanding, food, wine, service!

This review is purely for the customer service.  Had to last minute cancel my reservation and knew about the cancellation fee. What I didn't know is that they would charge me 2.5x the amount advertised on the website. To make matters worse, everytime I call no one can resolve this issue and they just take a message and never get back to you...
Waited too long to get anything

(Translated by Google) But what happened? What a disappointment. Of course more than fifteen years have passed since I did not have dinner there. But even though the dishes were quite good, I Ricchi had a certain special Italian atmosphere in the 90s and early 2000s. And that was just what was missing: there was no Italian around. The girl who received us was African-American, and tried to make us sit at the bar when we had a reservation for dinner. We had arrived 5 minutes early, and the restaurant was almost empty — tables were off the hook. Then our maid was Filipino and the one who cleared was Hispano. Well, people are what they are, but they couldn't even pronounce the names of the dishes. Then she insisted on describing (if not reading) all the dishes on the list. We know very well how to read, and then we know Italian cuisine. I must also say that to see the Caprese salad with "balsamic reduction" on the menu, I immediately realized that the kitchen in this restaurant had become Americanized. And yet the Filipina insisted that everything was very authentic. It has become an extra Italian restaurant in Washington that tells me nothing more. Sin.  (Original) Ma cos’è successo? Che delusione. Certo che sono passati più di quindici anni che non ci ho cenato.  Ma anche se  i piatti erano abbastanza buoni, I Ricchi aveva un certo ambiente speciale ed italiano negli anni 90 e nei primi anni 2000.  Ed era proprio quello che mancava: non  c’era nessun italiano in giro. La ragazza che ci ha ricevuti era afro-americana, ed ha cercato di farci sedere al bar quando avevamo la prenotazione per cenare. Eravamo arrivati con 5 minuti di anticipo, ed il ristorante era quasi vuoto—tavoli ce n’eranon a voglia. Poi la nostra cameriera era filippina e quello che ha sparecchiato era hispano. Vabbè la gente è quella che è, ma non sapevano neanche pronunciare i nomi dei piatti. Poi lei ha insistito a descrivere (se non leggere) tutti i piatti sulla lista. Sappiamo benissimo leggere, e poi la cucina italiana la conosciamo. Devo anche dire che a vedere l’insalata caprese con “balsamic reduction” sul menu, ho capito subito che la cucina in questo ristorante si era americanizzata. Eppur la filippina ha insistito che era tutto molto autentico. È diventato un ristorante italiano in più a  Washington che non mi dice più niente. Peccato.
Outstanding food and service
Great food and great service! I will definitely be back again soon.
Lovely atmosphere with great, authentic pasta. The olive oil served with the complimentary bread is the best I've ever had.
(Translated by Google) It's all good, but there are some mosquitoes under the table.  (Original) 다 좋은데 테이블 밑에 모기가 좀 있어서 잡아야 할 듯 해요.

Very classy Italin place in DC. Came here for dinner with my gf and everything was delicious!! The scallops appetizer, squid ink pasta and the strawberry desert were all on point and very flavorful! Service was just as good and the table was cleared after each course. A bit pricey but you definitely get what you pay for. Food was so good I forgot to take pictures. Definitely a must place for a romantic dinner.
Probably the best Italian food I've had.
Pasta uniquely flavored with fresh seafood. Very eloquent atmosphere and service is incompatible. Enjoyed it!
Great food & good taste!!
Past it’s prime. Tired interior and menu,   May have been good one day in the past but no longer the case
Amazing restaurant! Customer service is second to none! Menu provides a wide variety of Italian selections.  Free valet parking is nice too! Highly recommended!
Great food and attentive waiter. Overall a very great experience. Purchased a Groupon which was a fantastic deal.
Fantastic. Was with a group and each course was better than the one before.
Friendly professional service, bland salty food.
Great service and delicious food.
Great food, service and ambiance.  Food was a bit salty, but cooked to perfection.  Didn't feel rushed and the menu had a ton of great choices.  Would return.
Excellent food and great service. Rather on the pricey side, though.
Great food and even better service

Best to go Tuesdays for the Women's Club. I enjoy the risotto specials. I love Jackie. The management is very friendly. Fresh bread is wonderful. Also a fun place to scope out DC Elites if you're into that sort of thing.
Always consistent
Noisy. Appetizers and dessert were good, not great. Tortellini entree was excellent.
Very expensive and wait staff wasn't entirely knowledgeable, but the food was good.

Very good pasta (I had the squid ink pasta), but really expensive and honestly, a little over priced.  There were 4 of us. We had a couple of appetizers, four lower/mid priced entrees, and a bottle of moderately priced wine, and the bill was almost $250.
Loved the food the service and atmosphere.
Great!!!!  Nice service.   Terrific Italian food
Beautiful atmosphere and delicious food. The staff treated us like a King and Queen. Will definitely be back.
The food and the staff at this restaurant our top notch. I recommend you make reservation's.
The ambiance is so romantic; I especially enjoyed the taper candle at the table.. The service was excellent. The food was delicious.
Fantastic!!!! food and staff

Rich food, proper portions, and great presentation. Definitely more upscale than my friends and I anticipated. Our waiter was a bit uptight, but I love the women’s pricing they do on Tuesdays! Very pocket friendly.  Aside from that special difference, the cost is what you’d expect.
We had a great time.  Hobie is an amazing server - worth going just to hear him pronounce all the dishes.  A true gem.
Food was cold and the waiter was a bit short
My 14 year old son's all time favorite place to eat! Best Italian food in DC!
Awesome ... go hungry!
30 minutes to get our food bad service
(Translated by Google) Excellent food. Very comfortable. Good service  (Original) Excelente comida. Muito aconchegante. Bom atendimento
Amazing food and service
A longtime favorite with consistency and quality. It's always a good sign to see familiar staff faces year after year - a true sign of quality and Christina Ricchi's excellent culture.
Nice food good service little pricey........
Gracious staff. Delightful romantic ambiance. Elegant decor. Uniquely well-crafted dishes. Thank you for a memorable evening!
Terrible
Experienced wait staff and great food
Great service and great food. The walnut cheesecake is insanely good.

Disappointing, with two exceptions. We ordered six items. Two were quite good. The others were mediocre. Our appetizers were fried calamari and a scallop/gnocchi/mushroom dish. The calamari was average, not bad, but the orange/red dipping sauce was flavorless and needed heat (peppers). The scallop/gnocchi was better but still not what I'd call delicious. Our pasta course was excellent: a house-made spiral pasta with salmon in a cream sauce that should be placed on the regular menu (it was a daily "special") and a mushroom risotto that was splendid. Finally, we ordered a T-bone steak and an 8 oz filet "Gypsy style." I didn't taste the T-bone but my companion said it lacked flavor and was tough. I ate the filet although I could not taste the meat because of the riotous "Gypsy" ingredients, but the thing that utterly ruined it for me was a timbale with white truffle. Now, I don't know if it was real truffle shavings or truffle oil (which is a lab-made chemical flavoring, but it overwhelmed the entire dish with that noxious, obrtbearing, truffle-oil flavor. Very disappointing. I heard that some of the desserts were good, but we we're too full.
True Tuscan Italian restaurant with fabulous food and service!
Food very bad.  Service good.

Always a great dinner here. Sometimes the Antipasti are as filling as the Pasta or Secondi. A good example is the minestrone soup I enjoyed the other night, a special on the day's menu. The description said it contained 10 vegetables! I lost count at five, and that didn't include the cannellini beans. It was delicious!
Sort of Meh.
Delicious
Excellent food and service
Real authentic  Tuscan  recipes!
Friday patio popups are awesome!

I broke Dining Rule #1 and ordered a steak at an Italian Restaurant.  It was the absolute driest cut I've ever had.  (Medium)  What made the experience even worse is that our waiter completely forgot about us when another table was seated.  Valentines Day wasn't ruined but I'll never patronize this restaurant again...
Best Tiramisu in the city. The bread is to die for. Service is excellent, and some of the best around. Additionally the food is fresh with subtle flavors. Definitely stop by.

My friends and I enjoyed lunch here during Restaurant Week. To start us off, the server poured olive oil on our bread plates with a small dab of balsamic vinegar in the center, and then gave us a bread basket of strips of an Italian bread, some having a slice of tomato baked on top - delicious. I started with the bruchetta, which was a huge slice of Italian bread cut into thirds: one part topped with cannoli beans, one piled high with small cubes of perfectly ripened tomatoes doused in olive oil and fresh herbs (my favorite), and one topped with whipped ricotta (about twice  as much as could be eaten). The salmon entree turned out to be large chunks of cooked cold salmon atop a bed of greens with random accompanying items including half a hard boiled egg - the serving was not exciting or even spiced noticeably but provided a pleasant lunch. For my dessert, the tiramisu was a tastefully done 3-inch square. My friends enjoyed other dessert options: blueberry panna cota and gelato served with a huge sweet biscuit. We enjoyed the meal but it did not seem particularly Italian and did not inspire any desire to make another visit soon.

Wine list is great, cocktails are fun. Food is usually wonderful, but I would skip their restaurant week menu. Ordered the Pesce and it was literally two shrimp with tomato sauce on top... The other options looked just as simple. Regular menu is much better.
Went for a company promotional dinner, idk if it was just what the company ordered or if it was the restaurant but nothing exceptional.
Really good, really pricey
Disappointing. Badly behaved waiter. Felt sick after the meal. Wrote the restaurant about my experience afterwards and no answer, not even an acknowledgement. I won’t be going again.
Impeccable service and food. Expect the classics with innovative creations sprinkled among them
Visit this place when I'm on town for an annual conference. Meals are delicious and well proportioned. Save room for desert!
Excellent service and great staff
Went for a rehearsal dinner and everything was wonderful!! Very delightful staff and great food
Great food with top notch service.

Thoroughly enjoyed the food.  We had a set menu as part of a large party and i was unsure about the choices.  I had salmon with rapini and something else. It was delicious. We also had some appetizer plate.  The calamari was my favorite on the plate but all three were good.   I think it was bruschetta and toast with beans. Tiramisu for dessert is always the way to end the meal.
Pretty good food and very attentive staff.
Valet service. Great food. Excellent service. Moderately expensive.
(Translated by Google) I would love to have an experience in America it would be my dream  (Original) Vorrei tanto farmi una esperienza in America sarebbe il mio sogno
Superb quality dishes and impeccable service; have been going for many years.
Great service! excellent food. very nice environment to have a business lunch, where you can hear each other. The maitre d was very accommodating to a late guest.

Great outdoor seating! We were able to get a coupon on a deal site for 2 appetizers and 2 entrees for about half price. The pasta, like the pictured squid ink pasta with house made sausage, was lovely. If you like mushrooms, dont pass up the fungi appetizer.
Excellent food and top notch service. Easily a neighborhood favorite.
Good food wonderful staff
Great food - best pasta in DC
Good food and filling portions. The staff was exceedingly kind and very welcoming. We left full and satisfied and will return.

Their food made me feel like I was back in Italy again. Best Italian food in Washington DC. Really recommend if you love Italian food and it was the perfect price. Definitely go during the Cherry Blossom Festival because they have the cherry picks menu which is what I got and it was amazing.
Fabulous lunch!

Amazing food! We came for lunch and I had the seasonal char and my friend ordered the seasonal pasta with a salmon—it was so much food but we made it through dessert and I would come back just for the dessert! The chocolate meringue is now my new favorite dessert and my friend loved the cheesecake too! I’m definitely coming back
Great service.  Straight forward, outstanding cuisine.
Great food, great service.
Authentic excellent Italian!!
Great meal.  Outstanding service.  New Tuscan specials of the day.
Excellent authentic  Italian food.
Very authentic Tuscan dinner. Great atmosphere and wonderful service

Love this restaurant! The food and service is excellent. If you are able to obtain a Groupon for it when it's available it's a great deal for what you will get! The scallops with gnocchi and the calamari appetizers are both delicious!

Went for restaurant week with a party of 6 and we were all very excited about the $35 pre fixed meal. We also ordered two $30 bottles of wine to share with the table.  The quality of the food was that of Italian chain restaurants, such as Buca di Beppo or Olive Garden, but you could tell that the food wasn't microwaved as they usually do at these chains. I Ricchi brags at taking pride in authentic Tuscan fare, but as someone who has lived in the Tuscan region it was far from such and ultimately a huge let down. The dishes we ordered were also missing many of the elements the menu stated they would have. For example, my cauliflower farro salad only a 5 grains of farro sprinkled on the top and was completely missing the cauliflower all together. Essentially, food was mediocre, not mind blowing as expected, and I would be reluctant to return to the restaurant even for the bargain pre fixed meal.  On top of this mediocre quality, our server (Said) was incredibly rude, blunt, and pushy. He judged our initial wine choice and pushed us towards more expensive options. He also offered us limoncello shots at the end and we accepted. In typical Italian restaurants (in both the US and in Italy), limoncello, amaretto, or sambuca is often given as a complimentary gift at the end of a meal to thank customers for business.  Upon receiving the bill, we realized that our server GROSSLY overcharged us for these sips of limoncello, and had automatically added a gratuity of 22% onto the bill. We were absolutely stunned but as this was a celebratory dinner, we were reluctant to ruin the mood and paid our bills in silence.  Upon returning to the table with our receipts to sign, our server than said that two of our cards had been declined stating that he "tried them multiple times but it looks like you're broke." We looked at him blankly and then he indicated that he had made a joke. This was incredibly distasteful, rude, and quite awkward.  I will never in my life be seen again in this hell hole of a restaurant and would suggest those who seek a pleasant dining experience to stay away. I would only recommend dining at i Ricchi to those who wish to be berated by their server and served mediocre food at exorbitant prices.
Fantastic meals. Everything was very well prepared and service was well orchestrated.
Feels like home when you walk in and the food makes it happen!!!

Fantastic service, pretty good food. Pollo Balsamico was very well cooked and the potatoes were a nice addition. I don't normally order dessert but I did here and it was a great end to a solid meal. Atmosphere was wonderful.
Nice upscale Italian restaurant. Good wine selection and fresh, good fiod.
Great food and atmosphere. Will go there again.
The food is amazing.
Wonderful ambiance, great service!
Wonderful food and service. Great place for a special occasion
Delicious. I had a pasta trio which was awesome, though the stuffed tortellini was by far my fave. Good ambiance, good date spot.
Great spot for receptions!

Excellent Italian food and good service.  The desserts are especially good.  Missing the fifth star because it is overpriced and the wait staff were not the most friendly, they seemed in a hurry to have us in and out, at $120 apiece that isn't cool.  A colleague of mine ordered a pasta course and got a few medium-sized tortellini that weren't especially fancy for $26.  The calamari we had were had some tough pieces.  Altogether the food was very good, but except for dessert we could have had an equivalent experience at half the price elsewhere.
Me and my husband came here for our 1 year anniversary food was amazing and ambience was even better.

I don't know what was more amazing, the food or the service! I am not in Washington DC all the time, but I will definitely go back next time I'm there. The service was impeccable, staff on hand took excellent care of us. I loved the extra attention. I would highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion! The food was fabulous! The scallops were perfectly cooked and the sauce and accompaniments were perfect. The risotto was to die for, with tons of lobster! My hubby's steak was so tender it hardly needed cutting and we were so full we couldn't even fit dessert, but took it back to the room with us for later. It was also awesome! I can't rave enough about I Ricchi!!

Charming warm ambiance inside. Terrace outside as well. Staff is very nice. We had the scallops (2, would have liked more but it was an appetizer) which were delicious and very good mussels; then the Milanese (a bit dry) and lamb chops. Very well cooked despite being thick, they were not the skinny kind with bones. We finished with a chocolate meringue dessert with mousse inside, highly recommended. So far they are on Groupon with a very good deal.

I wanted to take my fiancé on date here and had one of the worst experiences. The food was ok, but not worth the high price tag. The service was straight up awful. Rude and disrespectful! That's the short version. Long version: I came here with a coupon and we felt that we got treated differently because of that. We got seated at the worst table in the restaurant. A tiny table right at the wall with not enough space to move. After asking they were so nice to give us a new table. So far so good. Then the waiter came. He was very rude and made us feel uncomfortable with the way he talked down to us. I had bought the groupon three course menu for two with wine. First, there are some limitations as to what you can order. Some entrees require an 8$ update and you can only choose between the red or White House wine, which is ok to me. I just would have liked to know that before going. The gypsy style filet was overcooked and nothing special.

Food was mediocre, the service was horrible. They set us at the worst table, even though the restaurant had plenty other free tables. The waiter was very rude and disrespectful, talked down to us. Will recommend stay away from this place, you can find much better Italian restaurants.
I was surprised when the waitress suggested the chicken and to my surprise wad amazing.

Very nice cozy place, food is great. I had chosen Groupon coupon value of 169$ for two guests but we didn’t get that amount of food and drinks they just tried to give cheapest ones. That value is not for what we choose. It includes appetizers, main course wines and desserts.Total was 120$ something. I could say it was waste of money. If you want to eat there don’t use Groupon. If you don’t use Groupon you might get what ever you want also you manage your total or value.
Everything was absolutely amazing. Great food, wonderful ambience, serving staff are extremely knowledgeable of the menu and very attentive, great wine list. The desserts were absolute perfection.
The food, drinks, service, and ambiance were excellent. However, my expectations were quite high and for the price, I was satisfied but not amazed.
Excellent service, ambiance and authentic Italian food
Pretty good food
The food was exquisite. The service was super slow.
Awesome food and service!  Will return on my next visit
Old school Italian eating in DC
Food and atmosphere were great. Our server was Hicham and was great host. Suggestions were spot on.
Great food and gracious, old-fashioned service.
Scollop appetizer unbelievable! Sauce incredible. Gypsy steak so tender you can cut it with a fork! Cannot wait to see what dessert is like. Definitely give this a superior rating.
Service was great Jacklyn was well informed food tasted like home and love and reminded me of an Italian grandma I never had but always wanted
Great service but the food wasn't very good at all.  Given the price you're paying, I'd avoid this place.  The waiter was friendly and helpful in selecting a good wine to pair with our dinner.
Food, service, and atmosphere excellent.

My wife and I had dinner here last week.  I am generally leery of Italian restaurants having grown up in an italian-american household with a large extended family of cooks.  Too often I leave an italian restaurant and know there was little care or life put into the meal that I just consumed.  Not this time.  From the moment we entered the space we were delighted -- welcomed at the door, welcomed at the reservation desk, promptly seated, and welcomed by the server (Jackie) and her apprentice.  And then we got to the pre-dinner cocktail, menu, and wine list.  Much to be pleased with here - a solid array of appetizers, first, and second courses.  There is no need to say much about our specific order except that I did order the meatballs appetizer.  I report this only because I am somewhat of a meatball snob.  The plate was sizeable and the taste was superb.  As was my wife's appetizer and the dinner courses.  Throughout, the service was very nice.  If you are not careful, though, you can blast through cocktails, appetizer, dinner, dessert, and coffee in seventy-five minutes.  That's good if you are heading to a show but not so good for relaxation. Still, there was no sense of being hurried, just attended to.  The restaurant has a lively "happy hour" so diners should avoid any of the bar seating unless you enjoy that type of atmosphere as a digestive aid.  All in all, we will return, we will host friends, and we will tell all that we had a splendid time at I Ricchi.
The waitress didn't seem to know what she was. Doing and they treated other staff poorly even in front of customers
Great service, tastey food

This place has become my favorite neighborhood haunt.  Their regular events are awesome...make sure to ask about them!  The meatballs on polenta and the tortelloni are my favorite go to meals!!!  I go so often, everybody there knows my name!! Highly recommended

Thank you so much for the dinning experience. I’ve never had one quite like this anywhere else. This is the reason why I Ricchi is by far the best dinning option I recommend to anyone in DC.  Anastasia was a breath of fresh air and had smiles for days. She was pleasant all the way through. The bartender, for the life of me I cannot recall his name, was very charming and held a very entertaining conversation with me while I was waiting for my table. He gave me his recommendations and they were on point and delicious. Tia was amazing as well. Her knowledge on the specials and dishes offered I Ricchi was mind blowing. Not even I could remember all of that. Her service was top notch. She is truly a gem. All in all, the staff was excellent, the food was magnificent and I felt welcomed. Everyone that I encountered was very pleasant.
Very good rustic, northern Italian restaurant.  Breads they make are superb.  We tried a number of dishes and they were all excellent.  Maybe the best service I have ever experienced in DC.

We had a business dinner for 4 people. Our waitress was rude and condescending.  She was very knowledgeable of the food but "required" that we order our appetizers and mains at the same time.  She seemed unable to accept anything but her method for our order.  The food was good but I would not return.
(Translated by Google) A slightly upscale Italian restaurant Come to talks  (Original) 少し高級なイタリアレストラン 商談にはさいてき
Always great food
Outstanding restaurant. Excellent service and cuisine. Excellent wine list.
Authentic classy Italian cooking. Posh service without the attitude, indeed, with genuine warmth.

(Translated by Google) A place with normal decoration, a slow and troubled service when there is a lot of customer flow. It would be a normal restaurant tending to bad if it wasn't for the Rigatoni with meat. This dish is simply fantastic.  (Original) Un lugar con decoración normal, un servicio lento y con problemas cuando hay mucho flujo de clientes. Sería un restaurante normal tendiendo a malo si no fuese por el Rigatoni con carne. Este plato es simplemente fantástico.
Best Plate "Rigatoni Stascicate"

The only thing that marred the evening was a mistake in the kitchen regarding our order.  So one plate was significantly delayed getting to table.  Otherwise it was an exceptional meal.  Friendly people and excellent service (ask for Tia).  My first experience at I Ricchi was about a year after it opened.  Thought it was exceptional then.  And I think it remains exceptional now.  BTW, the Mixed Grill is amazing!

I have eaten here several times but my last experience was amazing and the best ever! I met two very dear and old friends for lunch. I was greeted and soon my party joined me. The food was excellent and our server was very sweet and personable. I can't recommend this restaurant enough. Just a great experience with my friends made outstanding by the staff!

Terrible.  I wasn't feeling very well, and thus didn't want to eat very much, but the waiter picked up on it right away that I/we wouldn't be ordering too much and gave me the brushoff.  Extremely rude, acting like this was some big-time restaurant.   The pasta I ultimately got was all dried-out, as well.  Awful.  Especially when there are so many excellent alternatives in this town.
Carlos, our server, made this a fantastic eating experience! He was superb as was the food. I can't recommend it enough. Eat at I Ricci's and you will be glad you did.

Disclaimer: I'm super biased because this is my favorite restaurant in DC.  I Ricchi is amazing. One of the few places that offers a free valet service, which is almost harder to find then a downtown parking spot. That definitely takes away a lot of the stress of eating out -- the "out" part and the adventures in parking that go along with it lol. If you happen to get there during happy hour, treat yourself to a cocktail (or two) and conversation with the friendliest bartenders around. Also, be on the lookout for the tastiest complementary appetizers delivered by waitstaff or even Ms. Ricchi herself, who by the way is an amazing woman.  After being seated, you're promptly greeted by professional (extra emphasis on professional) waitstaff who are both  knowledgeable about everything on the menu as well as good pairings and display an unparamounted attentiveness and courtiousness to each customer.  Now to the main attraction: the food. It's always superb. I have never been to a more consistent restaurant at giving the highest quality of food and service. Everything is perfectly cooked and seasoned. And the homemade bread... my mouth waters just thinking of it. This last time I had the Bistecca Al'Arrabbiatta  (sp?) medium-rare, and it was the juiciest steak I'd had in a while. Served with grilled mixed vegetables and fried palenta. It was so good that I had to choose between devouring the whole meal and saving half so I could taste it again. Naturally, I saved some lol  (SCALE 1-5) SERVICE: 5 AMBIANCE: 5 PARKING/VALET: 5 FOOD: 5+ LIKELIHOOD TO RETURN: 5
The food was amazing the service was even better the seating was a little bit tight but it didnt matter much. We go here all the time

Great dining experience. Service was helpful and really friendly. Wines were reasonable priced for restaurant. Food was outstanding. Had risotto, outstanding. Then had swordfish special. Very well done.
Love everything we ordered .
715p reservation for 5. showed up 15min early, the restaurant was empty and we were pushed to "wait at the bar". staff was very rude and refused to seat us. we left and ate elsewhere, bad vibes.
(Translated by Google) not very good  (Original) non molto buono

There is one grade for this restaurant. It is this. This is the only Italian Restaurant I can honestly patronize in the DC area. It is perfect. I am Italian American, I can make most of the food that you get in Italian Restaurants. The food here is so far above an Italian Restaurant, it deserves just being called I Ricchi. If you like food, you will sit and marvel all night.  Then there is the service, which is impeccable.  I will take off a half point for the cacaphonous room, but it is not usually an issue.

When we lived in Boston, my husband came to D.C. on business and called i Ricchi "his oasis". That was when i Ricchi first opened, 27 years ago. Indeed, eventually dining with him at the restaurant during the 1990s, what stood out was the hushed atmosphere, excellent food, but mostly the impeccible and unobtrusive wait staff. In fact, when we ate there with a friend two years ago, we were still very much pleased with the food, and with the waiter who was attentive but not hanging over us.  Last night, we decided to try the restaurant again for an early Mothers' Day celebration - just the two of us - for a quiet evening alone. Our waitress was so obtrusive I came away feeling as though an uninvited guest had joined us at the table. It was surprising enough that, when our meals arrived, she insisted on leaning over our plates, describing each item we had ordered (as if we didn't remember), but upon delivering our dessert menus, she insisted on standing there and reading the selections to us! Besides all this, she seemed to be training another waitress (on a Saturday evening?), and the woman, who shadowed her, looked scared.  My beet salad, Bronzino, and the semifreddo (a layered meringue dessert) were delicious. The fish was very hot, juicy, and flavorful. The green beans were cooked perfectly. We were told desserts are house-made, and it showed. My husband ordered the Caprese salad; had issues with the Mixed Grill (the prosciutto made the quail too salty, and the meat had not been cooked properly). He liked the cheesecake, but didn't rave about it. In general, it seemed a very basic menu, with no creative surprises.
Love this woman run restaurant!! Can't wait to go back again!!
Food was great. Happy Hour is a definite! Waiters were amazing.
Love the food, the atmosphere is very chic the staff is very friendly and courteous. And very attentive to your needs.
Waiter was rude and sarcastic. Food took forever to get to my table. Waste of money.
My favorite DC restaurant! Love the food, service, and atmosphere.
The food here was really good. The service was top notch but the price was a bit high. Overall it's a great option but know you'll be selling out some bucks to eat here.
Lasagna was on point. Sooo cheesy!!!
I went twice with my wife using living social and was delighted

I absolutely love this place. I was introduced by our CEO - who is a complete Foodie - and cannot stop going back. Their service is always fabulous, Christianne Ricchi is so gracious and welcoming and that truly comes through in her restaurant. If you haven't been here you are truly missing out on DC's best Italian!
(Translated by Google) The restaurant more crap garbage  (Original) El restaurante mas mierda basuras
Fantastic Place!!
This place is horrible and expensive.
Fabulous authentic Tuscan style Italian food  The risotto is the best I've ever had !!
The food was awesome. The people were nice and the wine was great. Couldn't ask for more. Thank you, I Ricchi!
The food is excellent, the service is wonderful. I work right up the street and always come in.

Made reservations, but when we arrived the table was not ready for 10 minutes, We were made to stand because they were not enough seats at bar. Wasn't even offered an apology, just "wait till we find a table" from a disgruntled manager. Ordered drinks before ordering food, never showed up. When we ordered food, they wouldn't allow us to make any alterations to the food to accommodate our dietary and health needs. Ended up leaving without any apology. HORRIBLE PLACE. Do not go here unless you want to be treated like garbage.

I've waited tables for about 6 years so you get context on where I'm coming from. I had a date night here last night with a Groupon that costed $70 and got all the following for both me and my date each: 1 glass prosecco + 1 glass wine, 1 appetizer/starter, 1 entree and 1 dessert. Incredible deal from Groupon (was a $170 value) + $35 tip = barely over $100 out the door for a very nice three-course meal with wine for two people. The rating breakdown...  Atmosphere: 4/5 Very nice. Warm, calm, and clean with lots of foliage around the windows. Lighting and music were appropriate.  Service: 4/5 The hostess was a little cold/dry and the bartender (before being seated at our table) was very rigid and formal. I understand the atmosphere/caliber of the place but seeing as me and my date are young and vibrant compared to most of the clientele that was there at the time, you'd think the bartender would be a little more lively to us. The waitress we had, however, was very pleasant and thoroughly knowledgeable about what was on the menu. Constant attention when needed without being overbearing. A fantastic service experience...also, those bussers were very punctual and on point for the wait staff.  Food: 5/5 A fully Tuscan menu with a good range of options to choose from. Waitress was very knowledgeable and was able to provide answers to questions as well as her opinion on the dishes themselves.  Everything was delicious and wonderfully prepared. The presentation was solid, but the flavor just exploded in every dish. I got the special appetizer, the house-cured salmon with baby greens (GET THIS if they have it...some of the best salmon I've ever had), the entree Grigliata Mista della Casa (Mixed grill of marinated pork loin, rabbit sausage, lamb chop, and stuffed baby quail)...out of this world. She got the mixed mushrooms (very rich and savory) and the filet (incredibly tender and flavorful). The dessert was good too, the walnut encrusted mascarpone cheesecake...nutty and delicate, with a lighter texture than average cheesecake.  Price/value: 4/5 Without the Groupon, the total cost would have been double what it was...in which case it's quite expensive. The quality of food and service, however, I would say make up for it on it's own. WITH the Groupon, though? Truly worth every penny.  Overall: 5/5 Highly recommended! The food alone is stellar enough to merit a 5...
Had food poison there - both people had the same thing and the manager said he doesn't believe it is food poison - had vomiting, fever and everything.

I was in DC on business and my dining partner had purchased a groupon for $69.  Curious, I read some of the recent reviews ahead of time, which made me play close attention.  Here is what I found:  the service was excellent - our waiter was well informed about the menu items and made helpful suggestions.  He was attentive without being pushy.  All (!) items on the menu were available to us, including the higher-priced items, so we ended up with a huge discount.  I found the quality of the food to be superb and the portion sizes huge, particularly the appetizers.  The desert was to die for, which was a great way top of a wonderful dining experience.  I would definitely come here again, though I must say that the prices are quite high, particularly for someone from the middle of the country.  If you can expense it, more power to you.

I've dined at I Ricchi before, and enjoyed the food and service. I decided to go there with my mother. The wait service was helpful and very polite. The food was good, in general, however they did not cook my mother's steak as ordered. That can be forgiven. When the entrée I ordered was not to my liking they replaced it. It was the service I'd come to expect from them. However, then an unfortunate event happened. Our waitress and the maî·tre d'hô·tel had an altercation. Not a fight, but a tense moment in my view. I could hear the maî·tre d'hô·tel discipline the waitress and telling her leave, to go home. The waitress seemed bothered, but kept her composure. She came over to tell us she was going to hand us over to another waiter, which was polite. We decided to tip her for her amazing service. Very angrily the maî·tre d'hô·tel rushed over and asked the waitress why she was still there. The span of time between then altercation and there exchange was short and the waitress was only being polite so we would not be caught off guard when a new waiter showed up. The maî·tre d'hô·tel's behavior was unprofessional in general for management, but completely unacceptable to display in the front of customers. We insisted that we would tip the waitress, it seemed the maî·tre d'hô·tel was annoyed at that. After than exchange the evening went down hill. They replaced my mother's steak, but it was still not correct. They replaced mine, and it was delicious, but by then we just wanted to leave. We asked for the meal to be packed up and we left.

I think **my favorite thing about I Ricchi is the free valet parking.** The food was okay, but nothing mind-blowing; no flavors really popped out. Our waiter was way too pushy. He didn't give us any breathing room. He tried to push us to order alcohol about 10 times. I had the Capesante Agrodolce (scallops), and the house cocktail (I believe it was prosecco and raspberry puree). I give it a C+ overall. The "+" really is because of the free valet parking.
Memorable evening.  Food was better than excellent as was the service. Loved it!

Overpriced, overpriced and overpriced.  And to say the least yuck.. Nothing was spectacular.  Nothing was even "good" everything was average at best.  I didn't even like the bread on the table (and I love bread!) The appetizers were overly salty.  The mushroom appetizer is a plate of sauteed mushrooms like I'd make to put in my spaghetti sauce.  The steak was well cooked but oddly spiced.  My friend said it tasted like meatloaf ..not what I'm looking for in a steak.  Her salmon was overcooked. The waiter was pushy.  We asked for one of our desserts to go and you would have thought I'd asked him to poke himself in the eye with the candle.

An employee of the restaurant took my credit card and either sold it to someone or used it himself to rack up charges.  I had to cancel my card today.  The restaurant fired the employee, but it was too late.

There is a reason they are resorting to Living Social and Groupon!!!!!!!! I am a business traveler that frequents DC on a weekly basis. I have dined at I Ricchi numerous times and have had great service and food. The last time I ate at I Ricchi was three weeks ago and not pleased! I thought it might be an off night. I revisited again tonight and was extremely disappointed with my meal. I ate a few bites and told waiter I did not like my meal. After a long wait he told me he talked to his manager and owner and gave me the full price meal. No offer for a different dish, complimentary dessert or price reduction. WILL NOT RETURN!!!! Too many great options for food in DC.

I am a former DC resident, who now lives in another city, and was in town this week for a work conference. I checked into my hotel (the St. Gregory) a bit late and was hungry for dinner. I didn't want to stray too far as I was monitoring my car in a metered spot. So, I ambled around the block and mentally turned down a few of the other cuisines and restaurants I passed on the way, deciding that I was really in the mood for Italian. As I mentioned, it was late, so I needed to pick something fairly quick and saw i Ricchi. The atmosphere looked nice and fairly understated, it was Tuscan Italian....Perfect for what I was looking for that night, but I wanted a top DC restaurant calibre meal as well since I was back in town! I COULD NOT believe the absolutely exorbitant and overblown prices. When I remembered "Hey, I'm in DC, so it's more expensive and maybe they are reflecting the incredible meal I am about to eat" I decided to stay and treat myself. WHAT A MISTAKE! The food was TERRIBLE! They had a "master" guest chef in from Tuscany and I think that she needs to go back to the drawing board and start with the basics again. The food was bland, skimpily portioned and boring. The noodles were completely overcooked and mushy (you are an ITALIAN restaurant--definitely need to get the noodles correct at a minimum). The fish was unseasoned and tasteless. I thought perhaps dessert would redeem itself, but even the Tiramisu was dry and had zero flavor. I was ASTOUNDED at my bill. I had one appertif, an appetizer, entree, glass of wine and dessert and it was over $100 just for me. I would never, ever eat here again and I do not recommend that any one else do either. YUCK! I want my money and the 45 minutes from my life back. (I was also completely rushed through my meal, though they didn't close for over an hour later)... How can a business like this stay competitive in that market where there are sooo many amazing dining establishments? Next time, I might even stick to the hotel dining options or get room service if venturing out meant this poor experience!
Food is only ok.  Pricey for what you get taste-wise.

While the food was good, the prices were outrageous. Good for a romantic evening with 6 waiters hovering around with nothing to do except clean out your wallet ($130 for 3 entrees, 1 glass of wine, soup was $22!)
Tourist trap. Waiter rushed us through like a bad stockbroker. The veal chop was slightly bigger than a lamb chop. Overpriced.
